title: Parsifal - Richard Wagner - Barenboim - Kupfer - Elming - Meier
description:
Excellent production of Wagner's final, and so beautiful, complexly harmonious opera of compassion, renunciation and redemption.

Conductor: Daniel Barenboim
Staged by: Harry Kupfer
Parsifal: Poul Elming
Kundry: Waltraud Meier
Amfortas: Falk Struckmann
Gurnemanz: John Tomlinson
Kllingsor: GÃƒÂ¼nter von Kannen
Titurel: Fritz HÃƒÂ¼bner
Berlin Staatsoper 1992

Subtitle files Included.
English, German, Spanish and French.

Good conducting, interesting production, well sung and very well acted.

I was particularly impressed with John Tomlinson who subtlety and touchingly expressed Gurnemanz's misunderstanding of every situation.

I originally downloaded this from a different site as VOB files (thanks). I have converted it into a handy mkv file. I think this was originally recorded onto a DVD-R from Swiss TV, hence the [b]French hard-subtitles[/b]. I have included synchronised [b]srt subtitles in English, German, Spanish and French[/b](slightly different translation to the French hard-subs). [b]To cover over the hard-subs with the srt-subs set your media player to give subtitles an opaque background.[/b] These subtitles were originally ripped from another production of Parsifal and then laboriously synchronised to this production.

Some Tech'
The recorded video was converted to an mkv (H.264  at 22.25 [RF]quality) and  
stereo AC3 audio was passed through.

I hope you enjoy.

meXme
